results.firPara: Mahmoud Dahouds agent has insisted the Liverpool target will not leave Borussia Mönchengladbach this summer and denied reports that the 20-year-old could be available for a cut-price fee of just £8.5m at the end of next season.
results.secPara: Dahoud, who was born in Syria, has been tracked by Jürgen Klopps club after an impressive season in which the Germany Under-21 midfielder made 32 Bundesliga appearances. Liverpool were informed last month that Gladbach have no intention of allowing him to leave after they sold fellow midfielder Granit Xhaka to Arsenal, with a number of other clubs believed to be interested.
results.webTitle: Liverpool target Mahmoud Dahoud ‘will stay at Borussia Mönchengladbach’

results.firPara: Arsène Wenger says that Gabriel Paulista will be out for six to eight weeks with the ankle injury he suffered in last Sundays pre-season friendly against Manchester City in Sweden.
results.secPara: The centre-half was taken from the field on a stretcher in stoppage time, marring the 3-2 victory, and there were fears that he could face an even longer lay-off.
results.webTitle: Arsenal’s Gabriel facing six to eight weeks out with ankle injury

results.firPara: Select your title winners, top goalscorer, relegation certainties, signing of the summer and first manager to be sacked
results.webTitle: Predict the Premier League in 2016-17: have your say in our pre-season polls

results.firPara: Kalidou Koulibalys agent has revealed the future of the Senegal defender will be resolved this week amid interest from Chelsea.
results.secPara: Antonio Contes side had a £42.5m offer for the 25-year-old rejected by Napoli earlier this week, with the Italian side holding out for a fee closer to £50m. Arsenal and Everton have also registered an interest in the product of the Metz youth academy, although they are not expected to follow that up.
results.webTitle: Chelsea target Kalidou Koulibaly’s future ‘to be resolved this week’

results.firPara: Francesco Guidolin has been selling some of his best players and only bringing in risky replacements, which means this season could be a tough one
results.secPara: Guardian writers predicted position 15th (NB this is not necessarily Michael Butlers prediction but the average of our writers tips)
results.webTitle: Premier League 2016-17 season preview No16: Swansea City | Michael Butler

results.firPara: The Argentina coach Edgardo Bauza has travelled to Spain in an effort to persuade Lionel Messi to stay on the national team.
results.secPara: Messi, a record five-times world player of the year, said in June that the national team is over for me following Argentinas loss in the Copa América final. That was Argentinas third straight loss in a final, including the 2014 World Cup.
results.webTitle: Argentina coach attempts to persuade Lionel Messi to come out of retirement

results.firPara: José Mourinho will need France midfielder to help push for league title while Pep Guardiola must fight battles at home and in Champions League
results.secPara: One of the many betting companies that regularly inveigle their less than subliminal messages into journalists in-boxes has just claimed money is pouring in on Manchester United for the title after they broke the transfer record by shelling out more than £90m on Paul Pogba.
results.webTitle: Paul Pogba and John Stones vital in different ways to Manchester clubs | Paul Wilson

results.firPara: Tottenhams attempt to sign Georges-Kévin Nkoudou is on the brink of collapse after a breakdown in negotiations with Marseille over the £11m winger.
results.secPara: Nkoudou had looked set to complete his protracted transfer to White Hart Lane this week after the Cameroon forward Clinton Njie received his work permit to move the other way on a season-long loan. However, despite reassurances the deal would go ahead from sources close to the player, it is understood Marseille are unhappy with the structure of the payments being proposed by the Tottenham chairman, Daniel Levy, having previously agreed to pay the majority of the fee up front.
results.webTitle: Tottenham’s move for Georges-Kévin Nkoudou on brink of collapse

results.firPara: Despite defensive errors against the South Americans, Jill Elliss USWNT have added fresh blood and still have better strikers and goalkeepers than their rivals
results.secPara: Despite defensive errors against the South Americans, Jill Elliss USWNT have added fresh blood and still have better strikers and goalkeepers than their rivals
results.webTitle: USA suffer a scare against Colombia but team has improved since World Cup

results.firPara: Paddy McNair and Donald Love are set to swap Manchester United for Sunderland after the clubs agreed a joint fee for the pair believed to be in the region of £6m. Providing they both pass medicals, the pair are expected to sign four-year contracts by the end of Wednesday.
results.secPara: David Moyes, Sunderlands new manager, knows the players from his Old Trafford days and believes they can help address problem positions in the squad he has inherited from Englands new manager, Sam Allardyce.
results.webTitle: Sunderland close on £6m Manchester United duo Paddy McNair and Donald Love
